meanings.definition: (verb) To be under the influence of alcohol or drugs.
meanings.sent1: After the party, he was completely trolleyed and couldn't walk straight.
meanings.sent2: She trolleyed herself with too many shots at the bar last night.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally trolleyed itself on the spilled wine and stumbled around.
meanings.sent4: The music festival trolleyed the crowd into a wild dancing frenzy.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the brewery trolleyed him back to memories of his college days.

meanings.sent1: He stumbled out of the pub, looking completely trolleyed.
meanings.sent2: The trolleyed man sang loudly in the street, drawing attention.
meanings.sent3: The trolleyed squirrel stumbled around the park, amusing the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The trolleyed laughter echoed through the night, signaling a good time.
meanings.sent5: Her trolleyed state was evident from her slurred speech and unsteady gait.

meanings.definition: (adverb) In a state of being heavily intoxicated.
meanings.sent1: She danced trolleyed at the party, not caring who watched.
meanings.sent2: The friends laughed trolleyed as they shared stories around the campfire.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes landed better with the trolleyed audience.
meanings.sent4: The night sky sparkled above the trolleyed city, painting a beautiful scene.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the barbeque filled the trolleyed air, making everyone hungry.
